definition: to go through water and tread on fire (idiom); not afraid of any difficulty
to go/to visit (e.g. another country)/to attend (a banquet etc)
surname Tang
rushing current
soup/hot or boiling water/decoction of medicinal herbs/water in which sth has been boiled
to tread on/to trample/to stamp/to fulfill/Taiwan pr. [dao4]
fire/urgent/ammunition/fiery or flaming/internal heat (Chinese medicine)/hot (popular)/classifier for military units (old)/Kangxi radical 86
surname Huo

sentences.english: I would to anything for your love in the coming year.
sentences.chinese: 在新的一年里，为了你的爱，我愿赴汤蹈火。

sentences.english: In order to achieve our goal, we should be ready to go through fire and water.
sentences.chinese: 为了实现梦想，我们应该做好赴汤蹈火的准备。

sentences.english: I wouldn't hesitate to go through fire and water for the just cause.
sentences.chinese: 为了正义事业赴汤蹈火在所不辞。

sentences.english: Mary; he would go through fire and water for her.
sentences.chinese: 吉姆恋慕玛丽，愿为她赴汤蹈火。

sentences.english: They went through fire and water together in the war , making them the best friends.
sentences.chinese: 他们在战争中赴汤蹈火，这使他们成了最好的朋友。

sentences.english: I'd go through fire and water for my good friend.
sentences.chinese: 我愿为我的好朋友赴汤蹈火。

sentences.english: This formidable battle, will threes wild heart clingy one place.
sentences.chinese: 这次赴汤蹈火之战，将三颗狂野的心紧贴一处。

sentences.english: He went through fire and flood to save his mother.
sentences.chinese: 他赴汤蹈火去救他母亲。

sentences.english: Jack is ready to go through hell to help his friend.
sentences.chinese: 为了帮助朋友，杰克准备赴汤蹈火。

sentences.english: They were always ready to go through fire and water for the sake of the Chinese people's liberation.
sentences.chinese: 他们随时准备为中国人民的解放而赴汤蹈火。

sentences.english: They would through fire and water to serve the people.
sentences.chinese: 为人民服务，他们愿意赴汤蹈火。

sentences.english: They would go through fire and water to serve the people.
sentences.chinese: 为人民服务他们甘愿赴汤蹈火。

sentences.english: I would do anything for you, baby, you know that.
sentences.chinese: 我愿为你赴汤蹈火，宝贝，你是知道的。

sentences.english: As you go through fire and water is not impossible.
sentences.chinese: 为你赴汤蹈火并非不可能。

sentences.english: The different heights that I go to just to make sure she is happy.
sentences.chinese: 我赴汤蹈火的原因只是为了让她开心。

sentences.english: He said he would go through fire and water for me.
sentences.chinese: 他说为了我他愿意赴汤蹈火。

definition: not to refuse to (idiom)/not to hesitate to
ten thousand deaths will not prevent me (idiom); ready to risk life and limb to help out
to offer one's life in sacrifice
lit. mountains of daggers and seas of flames/fig. extreme danger (idiom)
bravery with no thought of personal safety (idiom); risking life and limb/undaunted by perils
to spare no effort (idiom); to do one's utmost
to display utter loyalty/to be loyal to the end
not to be shirked without dishonor (idiom)/incumbent/bounden (duty)
to risk one's life
to follow everywhere/to always be there for sb at their beck and call
to dash on bravely with no thought of personal safety (idiom); undaunted by dangers/regardless of perils
to serve (in some capacity)/to work for
no complaints/to have no regrets
to bend to a task and spare no effort (idiom); striving to the utmost
until death puts an end (idiom); one's whole life/unto one's dying day
lit. to open one's liver and drip gall (idiom); wholehearted loyalty
